creditline: The Friends of Bruce Dayton Art Acquisition Fund, the Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Trust Fund, and the Joan and Gary Capen Endowment for Art Acquisition
inscription: An inscription in regular script written within the cartouche framed in a golden double-line on the top right hand reads: “Reverent deities of yakasa from the Eight Legions 天龍八部夜叉尊神”. Another inscription brushed in black ink in the lower right reads, “Sincerely commissioned by the devout Imperial Prince Zhuang 和碩莊親王發心誠造,” which is followed by a seal in four characters (partially damaged): "Treasure of Prince Zhuang 莊親王寶".
title: Buddhist painting depicting Guardian Yaksha figures
